Description: Conical bead: of glazed composition, decorated with incised spiral grooves. The glaze has decayed to a dull brown.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Chamber M69 deposit
Curator's comments: Chamber M seems to have been used as a rubbish hole: the objects in it were generally damaged. The latest pottery and flints date to the reign of Peribsen and the jewellery is not likely to be much earlier. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), 23, 26; with similar beads on pl. VIII, 164-7. E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), 290, no. 227. For similar Early Dynastic beads, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. XLI, 79; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), pl. 108, 1.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (188)
